stocktrader

Class StockList

  • java.lang.Object
    • stocktrader.StockList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OwnedStock

    public class StockList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that holds an ArrayList of stock quotes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StockList.StepThrough
      This private class implements the iterator design pattern for the StockList.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StockList()
      Constructs an empty list of stock quotes.

      Adds a stock to the list alphabetically (by stock symbol).

      This function attempts to add a StockQuote to the current StockList.

      Function that gets the size of the StockList.

      Function that checks if the StockList is empty.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StockList

        public StockList()
        Constructs an empty list of stock quotes. It is an ArrayList made up of StockQuotes.

    • Method Detail

      • isListEmpty

        public boolean isListEmpty()
        Function that checks if the StockList is empty.
        Returns:
        true if empty, false if not empty.

      • getListSize

        public int getListSize()
        Function that gets the size of the StockList.
        Returns:
        integer value of the StockList's size.

      • searchStock

        public StockQuote searchStock(java.lang.String symbol)
        Looks for a stock in the list by the stock's symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the stock being searched.
        Returns:
        stock if found, null if not.

      • addStock

        public void addStock(StockQuote stock)
        Adds a stock to the list alphabetically (by stock symbol). This method takes in a StockQuote and inserts it into the StockList. If the stock is already in the StockList, then it replaces that stock.
        Parameters:
        stock - that is to be added.

      • addStock

        public void addStock(java.lang.String stockSymbol)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This function attempts to add a StockQuote to the current StockList. This function does not return the result of searching for the stock online.
        Parameters:
        stockSymbol - to be searched online.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addStockIfFound

        public boolean addStockIfFound(java.lang.String stockSymbol)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This function attempts to add a StockQuote to the current StockList.
        Parameters:
        stockSymbol - to be searched online.
        Returns:
        true if a valid StockQuote is found, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeStock

        public void removeStock(java.lang.String stockSymbol)
        Removes a specific stock from the list of stocks based on the stock symbol.
        Parameters:
        stockSymbol - symbol of stock to be removed from the StockList.

      • removeStock

        public void removeStock(StockQuote stock)
        Makes a call to removeStock(String stockSymbol) and passes stock.getSymbol() as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        stock - to be removed from the StockList.

      • updateStockList

        public void updateStockList()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Function that updates every stock in the StockList.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • updateStockList

        public static StockList updateStockList(StockList list)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Function that calls updateStockList() using the parameter "list" as the calling object.
        Parameters:
        list, - of StockList type.
        Returns:
        updated list.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • stepThrough

        public Iterator stepThrough()
        This is the iterator implementation that steps through an entire StockList.
        Returns:
        the result of the StepThrough of the current item.

      • printList

        public void printList()
        This function is only used as a testing function. It makes a call to StockQuote's print function for every StockQuote inside of StockList.
